content.description:
Easy going, over patina and plates past 4 kinda run out bolts brings you to the crux, a funky as heck move up onto the cap stone which crowns the Rattlesnake Buttress this climb is on.

The crux move is very well protected - make a clip, start the move, back off, think, start again, repeat. Really cool head game makes this seem much harder than it is!
content.location: In the middle of the Wall of Buttresses climbing a face that goes up to an obvious Hershey Kiss shaped capstone.

content.description: Start up a 2 bolt face, then to a chimney and finish on a crack to the anchors. Using the posterior wall makes the beginning much easier.

Starting from ground level and just left of a tree climb the thin and balancy vertical face to anchors on a ledge.

Can be linked with

Branded

for one long pitch if mindful of rope drag.
content.location: Third buttress from the left directly below the highest point of the crag.

content.description:
Start off the ground on an easy handcrack that leads up to an exciting mantle (crux) bringing you to easier ground for the rest of the climb. Like all the climbs in the area, the crux is well protected but the easier stuff can feel a bit run out.

Tons of fun!
content.location: On the Battlement Buttress, the last large pinnacle on the Wall of Buttresses on the far right as you face the climbs.

content.description: Start off the large ledge, clip the first bolt and figure out good feet to push up and past the crux over the small roof. Climb the easy patinas to the top, best to rappel off to save your rope some wear. Also be careful when pulling the ropes, it is very easy to get them stuck on the featured face.
content.location: Center face of Virgin Buttress, best reached by scrambling up from left of the base of Queen's Chase then tunneling in and up to the ledge of the base of the climb.

content.description:
Pumpy and sustained climbing up a slightly overhanging patinaed face past three bolts to chain finish. Groundfall potential is a very real threat if the leader is not solid at the grade, so bring your A game!

The route has been extended as of December, 2008 to include a very low angle slab finish that is arguably needless, but the new anchors are much more bomber than the original.
content.protection:
Three bolts with optional small cam placement before first bolt.

Single chain anchor on top of small roof signals end of original route, new chains 20 feet higher on low angle slab are now the standard.
content.location:
The left most route of the Wall of Buttresses, the start is hidden from the ground (as are most in this area) and climbers must scramble through a cave to gain the belay.

It is a striking and obvious line that should be obvious to anyone looking at the wall.

content.description: Traverse in from the block at the base to climb the face above.
content.location: Right of The Mast on Redman Buttress.

content.description: A hard to protect chimney between Redman and Rifleman Buttress.
content.location: Chimney between Redman and Rifleman Buttress.

climbs.name: Cut the Crap, get Real Sweetheart

content.description:
Climb the right side of the Rattlesnake Buttress face past 3 bolts and join Sun Your Buns at the cap stone crux.

This route is a lot of fun and much easier than Sun Your Buns to the left, but gets the same rating (5.9) due to the shared finishing move up onto the capstone.
content.location: Right side of the Rattlesnake Buttress

climbs.name: Crow's Nest
climbs.fa: Kenn Kenaga, Travis McElvany, Pat Brennan 12-94

content.description: Climb the obvious offwidth on The Mast.
content.protection: Wide gear, use Hidden Treasures anchor.

content.description:
Climbs a chimney behind the buttress to access the ledge

Branded

starts from.
content.location:
Around and right of

Shakin' the Tree

.

content.description:
Fun climbing up the attractive vertical plated face starting from the ledge

Shakin' the Tree

ends at. An optional piece of gear (2-2.5 inch) can be placed mid-route. Can be combined with

Shakin' the Tree

for a single long pitch if mindful of rope drag.

The name is a result of the "branding" one of the first ascent party members got from a hot drill bit!

climbs.name: Basset Hound
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Mary Ann, Loehr, Pat Brennan 4-98

content.description: Climb an arete to the anchors.
content.location: Left arete of Hound Rock, far right side of Lower Buttresses.

content.description: A short finger crack that leads to the base of Hidden Treasures. Using the dihedral on the right makes it 5.7.
content.location: At the base of The Mast through a small cave.
